cyclone.name: MATTHEW
cyclone.current_location: about 275 miles SW of Port-au-Prince, Haiti
cyclone.trajectory: Continuing north across Haiti/eastern Cuba, then forecast to accelerate NNW–NW across the Bahamas and curve toward the southeast U.S. coastline, with the cone bringing the center near the South Carolina–southern North Carolina coast late Friday into Saturday.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near or just south of the South Carolina coast (closest U.S. coastal encounter)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch – Camaguey (Cuba), Turks & Caicos, Central Bahamas; Tropical Storm Watch – portions of Dominican Republic
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning – Jamaica, Haiti, E-Cuba provinces, SE Bahamas; Tropical Storm Warning – SW Dominican Republic
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Greater Antilles, Bahamas, Florida peninsula, Georgia through North Carolina barrier islands
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (34–50 kt) possible late Friday into Saturday with a low (≤24%) chance of gale onset.
weather_observation.storm_surge: If the center tracks close to the coast, surge 3–5 ft above normal tides is possible along the lower Cape Fear River and adjacent beaches.
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–8 inches of heavy rain possible, producing flash-flood risk in the Cape Fear basin.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Large surf, dangerous rip currents, and potential minor river flooding may disrupt port operations.
